column4: Where can I find a practical working example of the usage of a Secure Shell Key?
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-30709.html does not even mention the term "Secure Shell Key".
what do you think ssh-key stands for?
The article http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-30709.html includes ssh-keygen but not ssh-key.
what do you want to do, what do you need a tut for?
For using the the Secure Shell Key having the Key ID=FC2C... but no Validity in my Seahorse program.
seahorse? isn't that a gui to gnuPG?
Synaptic: "Seahorse is a GNOME front end for the program »Gnu Privacy Guard« (GnuPG)." --  My question is still unanswered.
nope you asked about secure shell keys, and that is something complete different from gnuüg
Please note that my program Seahorse lists a Secure Shell Key having the Key ID=FC2C...
since i never used that, i cannot answer it. but google needed about 0.1 sec to give http://debianadmin.com/ssh-key-authentication-using-seahorse-gui-html
Your article is dated December 2007 and does not reflect the usage in Ubuntu Karmic.
